File: vsip/core/subblock.hpp
   1/* Copyright (c) 2005, 2006, 2008 by CodeSourcery.  All rights reserved. */
   2
   3/** @file    vsip/core/subblock.hpp
   4    @author  Zack Weinberg
   5    @date    2005-01-28
   6    @brief   VSIPL++ Library: Subblock classes.
   7
   8  This file implements Block-interface classes which wrap other Blocks
   9  and rearrange the data they carry.  Currently we provide four wrappers:
  10
  11  1) Component_block: For blocks with complex values, expose only the
  12     real or imaginary components of those values.  Could be
  13     generalized to blocks with other non-scalar element types,
  14     e.g. quaternions, if anyone ever wants them.
  15
  16  2) Transposed_block, Permuted_block: Reorder the indices of an
  17     N-dimensional block (N>1).
  18
  19  3) Sliced_block: Bind one of the indices of an N-dimensional block (N>1)
  20     to a constant, producing an (N-1)-dimensional block.  For example,
  21     this can be used to extract a row or column vector from a matrix.
  22
  23  4) Subset_block: Without changing the dimensionality of a block,
  24     restrict access to a subset of its values: every other element of
  25     a 1-dimensional vector, or the upper left 3x3 of a 9x9 matrix.
  26     The subset pattern is restricted to what can be expressed by a
  27     Domain<N> where N is the underlying block's dimensionality.   */
  28
  29#ifndef VSIP_CORE_SUBBLOCK_HPP
  30#define VSIP_CORE_SUBBLOCK_HPP
  31
  32/***********************************************************************
  33  Included Files
  34***********************************************************************/
  35
  36#include <vsip/support.hpp>
  37#include <vsip/domain.hpp>
  38#include <vsip/core/map_fwd.hpp>
  39#include <vsip/core/refcount.hpp>
  40#include <vsip/core/static_assert.hpp>
  41#include <vsip/core/noncopyable.hpp>
  42#include <vsip/core/domain_utils.hpp>
  43#include <vsip/core/storage.hpp>
  44#include <vsip/core/parallel/local_map.hpp>
  45#include <vsip/core/parallel/subset_map_decl.hpp>
  46#include <vsip/core/parallel/transpose_map_decl.hpp>
  47#include <complex>

  50  Declarations
  51***********************************************************************/

  56namespace impl

  58
  59/// The Component_block class applies an "Extractor" policy to all
  60/// accesses via get() and put().  Everything else is deferred to the
  61/// underlying block.
  62template <typename Block,
  63          template <typename> class Extractor>
  64class Component_block : public impl::Non_assignable
  65{
  66  typedef Extractor<typename Block::value_type> extr_;
  67public:
  68  // Compile-time values and types.
  69  // The type of elements of this block is determined by the Extractor
  70  // instantiated for the Block's value_type.
  71  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim;
  72  typedef typename extr_::value_type  value_type;
  73  typedef value_type&       reference_type;
  74  typedef value_type const& const_reference_type;
  75  typedef typename Block::map_type map_type;
  76
  77  // Constructors and destructors.
  78  Component_block(Component_block const& b) : blk_(&*b.blk_) {}
  79  Component_block(Block &blk) VSIP_NOTHROW : blk_ (&blk) {}
  80  ~Component_block() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
  81
  82  // Accessors.
  83  length_type size() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return blk_->size();}
  84  length_type size(dimension_type block_d, dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
  85  { return blk_->size(block_d, d);}
  86  // These are noops as Component_block is helt by-value.
  87  void increment_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
  88  void decrement_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
  89  map_type const& map() const { return blk_->map();}
  90
  91  // Data accessors.
  92  value_type get(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW
  93  { return extr_::get(blk_->get(i));}
  94  value_type get(index_type i, index_type j) const VSIP_NOTHROW
  95  { return extr_::get(blk_->get(i, j));}
  96  value_type get(index_type i, index_type j, index_type k) const VSIP_NOTHROW
  97  { return extr_::get(blk_->get(i, j, k));}
  98
  99  void put(index_type i, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
 100  {
 101    typename Block::value_type tmp = blk_->get(i);
 102    extr_::set(tmp, val);
 103    blk_->put(i, tmp);
 104  }
 105  void put(index_type i, index_type j, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
 106  {
 107    typename Block::value_type tmp = blk_->get(i, j);
 108    extr_::set(tmp, val);
 109    blk_->put(i, j, tmp);
 110  }
 111  void put(index_type i, index_type j, index_type k, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
 112  {
 113    typename Block::value_type tmp = blk_->get(i, j, k);
 114    extr_::set(tmp, val);
 115    blk_->put(i, j, k, tmp);
 116  }
 117
 118  // Support Direct_data interface.
 119public:
 120  typedef impl::Storage<typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type, value_type>
 121		storage_type;
 122  typedef typename storage_type::type       data_type;
 123  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_data_type;
 124
 125  data_type       impl_data()       VSIP_NOTHROW
 126  { 
 127    return extr_::get_ptr(blk_->impl_data());
 128  }
 129
 130  const_data_type impl_data() const VSIP_NOTHROW
 131  { 
 132    return extr_::get_ptr(blk_->impl_data());
 133  }
 134
 135  stride_type impl_stride(dimension_type Dim, dimension_type d)
 136     const VSIP_NOTHROW
 137  {
 138    assert(Dim == dim && d<dim);
 139    if (Type_equal<typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type,
 140	           Cmplx_split_fmt>::value)
 141      return 1*blk_->impl_stride(dim, d);
 142    else
 143      return 2*blk_->impl_stride(dim, d);
 144  }
 145
 146  // Implementation specific.
 147public:
 148  Block const& impl_block() const { return *this->blk_; }
 149
 150private:
 151  // Data members.
 152  typename View_block_storage<Block>::type blk_;
 153};
 154
 155/// Store Component_blocks by-value.
 156template <typename Block,
 157          template <typename> class Extractor>
 158struct View_block_storage<Component_block<Block, Extractor> >
 159  : By_value_block_storage<Component_block<Block, Extractor> >
 160{};
 161
 162
 163/// Extractor classes for real and imaginary components.
 164template <typename Cplx>
 165class Real_extractor
 166{
 167public:
 168  typedef typename Cplx::value_type  value_type;
 169
 170  static value_type get(Cplx val) VSIP_NOTHROW { return val.real();}
 171  static void set(Cplx& elt, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW 
 172  {
 173    elt = Cplx(val, elt.imag());
 174  }
 175
 176  
 177  static value_type* get_ptr(complex<value_type>* data)
 178    { return reinterpret_cast<value_type*>(data); }
 179
 180  static value_type* get_ptr(std::pair<value_type*, value_type*> const& data)
 181    { return data.first; }
 182};
 183
 184template <typename Cplx>
 185class Imag_extractor
 186{
 187public:
 188  typedef typename Cplx::value_type  value_type;
 189
 190  static value_type get(Cplx val) VSIP_NOTHROW { return val.imag();}
 191  static void set(Cplx& elt, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW 
 192  {
 193    elt = Cplx(elt.real(), val);
 194  }
 195
 196  static value_type* get_ptr(complex<value_type>* data)
 197    { return reinterpret_cast<value_type*>(data) + 1; }
 198
 199  static value_type* get_ptr(std::pair<value_type*, value_type*> const& data)
 200    { return data.second; }
 201};
 202
 203
 204
 205template <typename Block,
 206          template <typename> class Extractor>
 207struct Block_layout<Component_block<Block, Extractor> >
 208{
 209  // Dimension: Same
 210  // Access   : Same
 211  // Order    : Same
 212  // Stride   : If split -> same
 213  //          : else     -> unknown
 214  // Cmplx    : Same
 215
 216  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim;
 217
 218  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::access_type  access_type;
 219  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::order_type   order_type;
 220  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type complex_type;
 221
 222  typedef typename
 223    ITE_Type<Type_equal<complex_type, Cmplx_split_fmt>::value,
 224	     As_type<typename Block_layout<Block>::pack_type>,
 225	     As_type<Stride_unknown> >::type pack_type;
 226
 227  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> layout_type;
 228};
 229
 230template <typename BlockT, template <typename> class Extractor>
 231struct Is_modifiable_block<Component_block<BlockT, Extractor> >
 232  : Is_modifiable_block<BlockT>
 233{};

 237/// Functor to create map for a subset block from its parent block's map.
 238/// (not a map class)
 239template <dimension_type Dim,
 240	  typename       MapT>
 241struct Subset_block_map
 242{
 243  typedef typename Map_subdomain<Dim, MapT>::type type;
 244
 245  static type convert_map(MapT const&        map,
 246			  Domain<Dim> const& dom)
 247  {
 248    return Map_subdomain<Dim, MapT>::project(map, dom);
 249  }
 250
 251  static index_type parent_subblock(MapT const&        map,
 252				    Domain<Dim> const& dom,
 253				    index_type         sb)
 254  {
 255    return Map_subdomain<Dim, MapT>::parent_subblock(map, dom, sb);
 256  }
 257};
 258
 259
 260
 261/// The Subset_block class maps all accesses through a Domain instance
 262/// before forwarding to the underlying block.  Thus, for instance, if
 263/// a 1-dimensional vector of length N is the underlying block, and the
 264/// Domain instance in use is Domain<1>(N/2)*2, then the Subset_block class
 265/// will expose every other element of the underlying block.
 266template <typename Block>
 267class Subset_block : public Non_assignable
 268{
 269public:
 270  // Compile-time values and types.
 271  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim;
 272  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
 273  typedef value_type&                reference_type;
 274  typedef value_type const&          const_reference_type;
 275
 276  typedef Subset_block_map<dim, typename Block::map_type> map_functor;
 277  typedef typename map_functor::type map_type;
 278
 279  // Constructors and destructors.
 280  Subset_block(Domain<dim> const& dom, Block &blk) VSIP_NOTHROW
 281    : blk_ (&blk),
 282      dom_ (dom),
 283      map_ (map_functor::convert_map(blk.map(), dom_))
 284  {
 285    // Sanity check that all of the Domain indices are within the
 286    // underlying block's range.  (If domain is empty, value
 287    // returned by impl_last() is not valid.)
 288    for (dimension_type d = 0; d < dim; d++)
 289    {
 290      assert(dom_[d].size() == 0 || dom_[d].first() < blk_->size(dim, d));
 291      assert(dom_[d].size() == 0 || dom_[d].impl_last() < blk_->size(dim, d));
 292    }
 293    map_.impl_apply(block_domain<dim>(*this));
 294  }
 295
 296  Subset_block(Subset_block const& b)
 297    : blk_ (&*b.blk_),
 298      dom_ (b.dom_),
 299      map_ (b.map_)
 300  {
 301    map_.impl_apply(block_domain<dim>(*this));
 302  }
 303
 304  ~Subset_block() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 305
 306  // Accessors.
 307  // The size of a Subset is the (total) size of its Domain(s), not
 308  // the size of the underlying block.
 309  length_type size() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return dom_.size();}
 310  length_type size(dimension_type block_d, dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 311  {
 312    assert(block_d == dim);
 313    assert(d < block_d);
 314    return dom_[d].size();
 315  }
 316
 317  // These are noops as Subset_block is held by-value.
 318  void increment_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 319  void decrement_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 320  map_type const& map() const { return this->map_;}
 321
 322  value_type get(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 323  {
 324    assert(i < this->size(1, 0));
 325    return blk_->get(dom_[0].impl_nth(i));
 326  }
 327  value_type get(index_type i, index_type j) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 328  {
 329    assert(i < this->size(2, 0));
 330    assert(j < this->size(2, 1));
 331    return blk_->get(dom_[0].impl_nth(i),
 332		     dom_[1].impl_nth(j));
 333  }
 334  value_type get(index_type i, index_type j, index_type k) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 335  {
 336    assert(i < this->size(3, 0));
 337    assert(j < this->size(3, 1));
 338    assert(k < this->size(3, 2));
 339    return blk_->get(dom_[0].impl_nth(i),
 340		     dom_[1].impl_nth(j),
 341		     dom_[2].impl_nth(k));
 342  }
 343
 344  void put(index_type i, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
 345  {
 346    blk_->put(dom_[0].impl_nth(i), val);
 347  }
 348  void put(index_type i, index_type j, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
 349  {
 350    blk_->put(dom_[0].impl_nth(i),
 351	      dom_[1].impl_nth(j), val);
 352  }
 353  void put(index_type i, index_type j, index_type k, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
 354  {
 355    blk_->put(dom_[0].impl_nth(i),
 356	      dom_[1].impl_nth(j),
 357	      dom_[2].impl_nth(k), val);
 358  }
 359
 360
 361  Block const& impl_block() const { return *this->blk_; }
 362  Domain<dim> const& impl_domain() const { return this->dom_; }
 363
 364
 365  // Lvalue interface
 366  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i) VSIP_NOTHROW
 367  {
 368    return blk_->impl_ref(dom_[0].impl_nth(i));
 369  }
 370  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j) VSIP_NOTHROW
 371  {
 372    return blk_->impl_ref(dom_[0].impl_nth(i),
 373                          dom_[1].impl_nth(j));
 374  }
 375  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j, index_type k) VSIP_NOTHROW
 376  {
 377    return blk_->impl_ref(dom_[0].impl_nth(i),
 378                          dom_[1].impl_nth(j),
 379                          dom_[2].impl_nth(k));
 380  }
 381
 382  // Support Direct_data interface.
 383public:
 384  typedef impl::Storage<typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type, value_type>
 385		storage_type;
 386  typedef typename storage_type::type       data_type;
 387  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_data_type;
 388
 389  par_ll_pbuf_type impl_ll_pbuf() VSIP_NOTHROW
 390  { return blk_->impl_ll_pbuf(); }
 391
 392  stride_type impl_offset() VSIP_NOTHROW
 393  {
 394    stride_type offset = blk_->impl_offset();
 395    for (dimension_type d=0; d<dim; ++d)
 396      offset += dom_[d].first() * blk_->impl_stride(dim, d);
 397    return offset;
 398  }
 399
 400  data_type       impl_data()       VSIP_NOTHROW
 401  { 
 402    data_type ptr = blk_->impl_data();
 403    for (dimension_type d=0; d<dim; ++d)
 404      ptr = storage_type::offset(ptr,
 405				 dom_[d].first() * blk_->impl_stride(dim, d));
 406    return ptr;
 407  }
 408
 409  const_data_type impl_data() const VSIP_NOTHROW
 410  { 
 411    data_type ptr = blk_->impl_data();
 412    for (dimension_type d=0; d<dim; ++d)
 413      ptr = storage_type::offset(ptr,
 414				 dom_[d].first() * blk_->impl_stride(dim, d));
 415    return ptr;
 416  }
 417
 418  stride_type impl_stride(dimension_type Dim, dimension_type d)
 419     const VSIP_NOTHROW
 420  {
 421    assert(Dim == dim && d<dim);
 422    return blk_->impl_stride(dim, d) * dom_[d].stride();
 423  }
 424
 425private:
 426  // Data members.
 427  typename View_block_storage<Block>::type blk_;
 428  Domain<dim> dom_;
 429  map_type    map_;
 430};
 431
 432// Store Subset_blocks by-value.
 433template <typename Block>
 434struct View_block_storage<Subset_block<Block> >
 435  : By_value_block_storage<Subset_block<Block> >
 436{};
 437
 438
 439template <typename BlockT>
 440struct Block_root<Subset_block<BlockT> >
 441{
 442  typedef typename Block_root<BlockT>::type type;
 443};
 444
 445template <typename       BlockT>
 446typename Block_root<Subset_block<BlockT> >::type const&
 447block_root(Subset_block<BlockT> const& block)
 448{
 449  return block_root(block.impl_block());
 450}

 453
 454template <typename Block>
 455struct Block_layout<Subset_block<Block> >
 456{
 457  // Dimension: Same
 458  // Access   : Same
 459  // Order    : Same
 460  // Stride   : Stride_unknown
 461  // Cmplx    : Same
 462
 463  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim;
 464
 465  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::access_type  access_type;
 466  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::order_type   order_type;
 467  typedef Stride_unknown                             pack_type;
 468  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type complex_type;
 469
 470  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> layout_type;
 471};
 472
 473// Subset_block has impl_ref if the underlying block has impl_ref.
 474template <typename Block>
 475struct Lvalue_factory_type<Subset_block<Block> >
 476{
 477  typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<Block>
 478    ::template Rebind<Subset_block<Block> >::type type;
 479  template <typename OtherBlock>
 480  struct Rebind {
 481    typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<Block>
 482      ::template Rebind<OtherBlock>::type type;
 483  };
 484};

 487struct Is_modifiable_block<Subset_block<BlockT> >
 488  : Is_modifiable_block<BlockT>

 493/// The Transposed_block class exchanges the order of indices to a
 494/// 2-dimensional block, and the dimensions visible via 2-argument
 495/// size().
 496template <typename Block> 
 497class Transposed_block;
 498
 499
 500/// Store Transposed_block by-value.
 501template <typename Block>
 502struct View_block_storage<Transposed_block<Block> >
 503  :  By_value_block_storage<Transposed_block<Block> >
 504{};
 505
 506template <typename Block>
 507class Transposed_block
 508    : public impl::Compile_time_assert<Block::dim == 2>,
 509      public impl::Non_assignable
 510{
 511  // Compile-time values and types (implementation detail).
 512private:
 513  typedef Transpose_map_of<2, typename Block::map_type> map_functor;
 514
 515  // Compile-time values and types (part of block interface).
 516public:
 517  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim;
 518  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
 519  typedef value_type&                reference_type;
 520  typedef value_type const&          const_reference_type;
 521  typedef typename map_functor::type map_type;
 522
 523  // Constructors and destructors.
 524  Transposed_block(Block &blk) VSIP_NOTHROW
 525    : blk_ (&blk)
 526    , map_ (map_functor::project(blk.map()))
 527  { map_.impl_apply(block_domain<dim>(*this)); }
 528
 529  Transposed_block(Transposed_block const& b)
 530    : blk_ (&*b.blk_)        // &* work's around holder's lack of copy-cons.
 531    , map_ (b.map_)
 532  { map_.impl_apply(block_domain<dim>(*this)); }
 533
 534  ~Transposed_block() VSIP_NOTHROW
 535    {}
 536
 537  // Accessors.
 538  length_type size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
 539    { return blk_->size(); }
 540  length_type size(dimension_type block_d, dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 541    {
 542      assert (block_d == 2);
 543      assert (d <= 1);
 544      return blk_->size(block_d, !d);
 545    }
 546  // These are noops as Transposed_block is held by-value.
 547  void increment_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 548  void decrement_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 549  map_type const& map() const { return map_; }
 550
 551  // Data accessors.
 552  value_type get(index_type i, index_type j) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 553    { return blk_->get(j, i); }
 554
 555  void put(index_type i, index_type j, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
 556    { return blk_->put(j, i, val); }
 557
 558  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j) VSIP_NOTHROW
 559    { return blk_->impl_ref(j, i); }
 560
 561  // Support Direct_data interface.
 562 public:
 563  typedef impl::Storage<typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type, value_type>
 564		storage_type;
 565  typedef typename storage_type::type       data_type;
 566  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_data_type;
 567
 568  data_type       impl_data()       VSIP_NOTHROW
 569  { return blk_->impl_data(); }
 570
 571  const_data_type impl_data() const VSIP_NOTHROW
 572  { return blk_->impl_data(); }
 573
 574  stride_type impl_stride(dimension_type Dim, dimension_type d)
 575     const VSIP_NOTHROW
 576  {
 577    assert(Dim == dim && d<dim);
 578    return blk_->impl_stride(dim, 1 - d);
 579  }
 580
 581public:
 582  Block const& impl_block() const { return *this->blk_; }
 583
 584 private:
 585  // Data members.
 586  typename View_block_storage<Block>::type blk_;
 587  map_type                                 map_;
 588};
 589
 590// Transposed_block impl_ref if the underlying block has impl_ref.
 591template <typename Block>
 592struct Lvalue_factory_type<Transposed_block<Block> >
 593{
 594  typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<Block>
 595    ::template Rebind<Transposed_block<Block> >::type type;
 596  template <typename OtherBlock>
 597  struct Rebind {
 598    typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<Block>
 599      ::template Rebind<OtherBlock>::type type;
 600  };
 601};
 602
 603template <typename BlockT>
 604struct Is_modifiable_block<Transposed_block<BlockT> >
 605  : Is_modifiable_block<BlockT>
 606{};

 609
 610// Take transpose of dimension-order.
 611template <typename T>
 612struct Transpose_order;
 613
 614template <dimension_type Dim0,
 615	  dimension_type Dim1,
 616	  dimension_type Dim2>
 617struct Transpose_order<tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> >
 618{
 619  typedef tuple<Dim1, Dim0, Dim2> type;
 620};
 621
 622
 623
 624template <typename Block>
 625struct Block_layout<Transposed_block<Block> >
 626{
 627  // Dimension: Same
 628  // Access   : Same
 629  // Order    : Reversed
 630  // Stride   :
 631  //    Stride_unit      -> Stride_unit
 632  //    Stride_unit_dense -> Stride_unit_dense
 633  //    Stride_unit_align -> Stride_unit
 634  //    Stride_unknown   -> Stride_unknown
 635  // Cmplx    : Same
 636
 637  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim;
 638
 639  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::access_type  access_type;
 640  typedef typename Transpose_order<
 641                      typename Block_layout<Block>::order_type>::type
 642					            order_type;
 643  typedef Stride_unknown                             pack_type;
 644  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type complex_type;
 645
 646  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> layout_type;
 647};
 648
 649
 650
 651/// The Permutor policy class provides functions which do the actual
 652/// argument reordering.  There is no general version, but below are
 653/// partial specializations for all permutations of <0,1,2>.
 654/// Block is the underlying block, Ordering is a tuple.  This class
 655/// is not used directly.
 656template <typename Block, typename Ordering> struct Permutor;
 657
 658/// The Permuted_block class reorders the indices to a 3-dimensional
 659/// block, and the dimensions visible via 2-argument size().  The
 660/// permutation is specified as a tuple (see [support]).
 661template <typename Block, typename Ordering>
 662class Permuted_block : Compile_time_assert<Block::dim == 3>,
 663                       Non_assignable
 664{
 665protected:
 666  // Policy class.
 667  typedef Permutor<Block, Ordering> perm_type;
 668
 669public:
 670  // Compile-time values and types.
 671  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim;
 672  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
 673  typedef value_type&       reference_type;
 674  typedef value_type const& const_reference_type;
 675  typedef typename Block::map_type map_type;
 676
 677  // Constructors and destructors.
 678  Permuted_block(Block &blk) VSIP_NOTHROW
 679    : blk_ (&blk)
 680    {}
 681  Permuted_block(Permuted_block const& pb) VSIP_NOTHROW
 682    : blk_ (&*pb.blk_)
 683    {}
 684  ~Permuted_block() VSIP_NOTHROW
 685    {}
 686
 687  // Accessors.
 688  length_type size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
 689    { return blk_->size(); }
 690  length_type size(dimension_type block_d, dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 691    { return blk_->size(block_d, perm_type::dimension_order(d)); }
 692  // These are noops as Transposed_block is held by-value.
 693  void increment_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 694  void decrement_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 695  map_type const& map() const { return blk_->map(); }
 696
 697  // Data accessors.
 698  value_type get(index_type i, index_type j, index_type k) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 699    { return perm_type::get(*blk_, i, j, k); }
 700
 701  void put(index_type i, index_type j, index_type k, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
 702    { perm_type::put(*blk_, i, j, k, val); }
 703
 704  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j, index_type k) VSIP_NOTHROW
 705    { return perm_type::impl_ref(*blk_, i, j, k); }
 706
 707  Block const& impl_block() const { return *this->blk_; }
 708
 709
 710  // Support Direct_data interface.
 711public:
 712  typedef impl::Storage<typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type, value_type>
 713		storage_type;
 714  typedef typename storage_type::type       data_type;
 715  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_data_type;
 716
 717  data_type       impl_data()       VSIP_NOTHROW
 718  { return blk_->impl_data(); }
 719
 720  const_data_type impl_data() const VSIP_NOTHROW
 721  { return blk_->impl_data(); }
 722
 723  stride_type impl_stride(dimension_type Dim, dimension_type d)
 724     const VSIP_NOTHROW
 725  {
 726    assert(Dim == dim && d<dim);
 727    return blk_->impl_stride(dim,  perm_type::dimension_order(d));
 728  }
 729
 730 private:
 731  // Data members.
 732  typename View_block_storage<Block>::type blk_;
 733};
 734
 735
 736/// Since all Permutor partial specializations differ only in the
 737/// permutation chosen, we use a macro to carry all the repeated text.
 738#define VSIP_IMPL_PERMUTOR_SPECIALIZATION(n0,n1,n2)                     \
 739template <typename Block>                                               \
 740struct Permutor<Block, tuple<n0, n1, n2> >                              \
 741{                                                                       \
 742  static dimension_type dimension_order(dimension_type d) VSIP_NOTHROW  \
 743    {                                                                   \
 744      static const dimension_type permutation[3] = { n0, n1, n2 };      \
 745      return permutation[d];                                            \
 746    }                                                                   \
 747  static typename Block::value_type                                     \
 748  get(Block const& blk, index_type i##n0, index_type i##n1,             \
 749      index_type i##n2) VSIP_NOTHROW                                    \
 750    { return blk.get(i0, i1, i2); }                                     \
 751  static void                                                           \
 752  put(Block& blk, index_type i##n0, index_type i##n1, index_type i##n2, \
 753      typename Block::value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW                      \
 754    { blk.put(i0, i1, i2, val); }                                       \
 755  static typename Block::reference_type                                 \
 756  impl_ref(Block& blk, index_type i##n0, index_type i##n1,              \
 757      index_type i##n2) VSIP_NOTHROW                                    \
 758    { return blk.impl_ref(i0, i1, i2); }                                \
 759}
 760
 761VSIP_IMPL_PERMUTOR_SPECIALIZATION(0,1,2);
 762VSIP_IMPL_PERMUTOR_SPECIALIZATION(1,0,2);
 763VSIP_IMPL_PERMUTOR_SPECIALIZATION(1,2,0);
 764VSIP_IMPL_PERMUTOR_SPECIALIZATION(2,1,0);
 765VSIP_IMPL_PERMUTOR_SPECIALIZATION(2,0,1);
 766VSIP_IMPL_PERMUTOR_SPECIALIZATION(0,2,1);
 767
 768#undef VSIP_IMPL_PERMUTOR_SPECIALIZATION
 769
 770
 771
 772/// Store Permuted_block by-value.
 773template <typename Block, typename Ordering>
 774struct View_block_storage<Permuted_block<Block, Ordering> >
 775  : By_value_block_storage<Permuted_block<Block, Ordering> >
 776{};
 777
 778/// Permuted_block has impl_ref if the underlying block has impl_ref.
 779template <typename Block, typename Ordering>
 780struct Lvalue_factory_type<Permuted_block<Block, Ordering> >
 781{
 782  typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<Block>
 783    ::template Rebind<Permuted_block<Block, Ordering> >::type type;
 784  template <typename OtherBlock>
 785  struct Rebind {
 786    typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<Block>
 787      ::template Rebind<OtherBlock>::type type;
 788  };
 789};
 790
 791template <typename BlockT, typename Ordering>
 792struct Is_modifiable_block<Permuted_block<BlockT, Ordering> >
 793  : Is_modifiable_block<BlockT>
 794{};
 795
 796
 797/// Take permutation of dimension-order.
 798template <typename PermutionT,		// Tuple expressing permutation
 799	  typename OrderT>		// Original dim-order
 800struct Permute_order;
 801
 802template <dimension_type Dim0, dimension_type Dim1, dimension_type Dim2>
 803struct Permute_order<tuple<0, 1, 2>, tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> >
 804{ typedef tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> type; };
 805
 806template <dimension_type Dim0, dimension_type Dim1, dimension_type Dim2>
 807struct Permute_order<tuple<1, 0, 2>, tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> >
 808{ typedef tuple<Dim1, Dim0, Dim2> type; };
 809
 810template <dimension_type Dim0, dimension_type Dim1, dimension_type Dim2>
 811struct Permute_order<tuple<0, 2, 1>, tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> >
 812{ typedef tuple<Dim0, Dim2, Dim1> type; };
 813
 814template <dimension_type Dim0, dimension_type Dim1, dimension_type Dim2>
 815struct Permute_order<tuple<1, 2, 0>, tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> >
 816{ typedef tuple<Dim1, Dim2, Dim0> type; };
 817
 818template <dimension_type Dim0, dimension_type Dim1, dimension_type Dim2>
 819struct Permute_order<tuple<2, 1, 0>, tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> >
 820{ typedef tuple<Dim2, Dim1, Dim0> type; };
 821
 822template <dimension_type Dim0, dimension_type Dim1, dimension_type Dim2>
 823struct Permute_order<tuple<2, 0, 1>, tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> >
 824{ typedef tuple<Dim2, Dim0, Dim1> type; };
 825
 826template <typename BlockT, typename PermutionT>
 827struct Block_layout<Permuted_block<BlockT, PermutionT> >
 828{
 829  // Dimension: Same
 830  // Access   : Same
 831  // Order    : permuted
 832  // Stride   : Stride_unknown
 833  // Cmplx    : Same
 834
 835  static dimension_type const dim = BlockT::dim;
 836
 837  typedef typename Block_layout<BlockT>::access_type  access_type;
 838  typedef typename Permute_order<PermutionT, 
 839                      typename Block_layout<BlockT>::order_type>::type
 840					            order_type;
 841  typedef Stride_unknown                             pack_type;
 842  typedef typename Block_layout<BlockT>::complex_type complex_type;
 843
 844  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> layout_type;
 845};
 846
 847
 848template <typename MapT, dimension_type SubDim>
 849struct Sliced_block_map {};
 850
 851template <typename MapT, dimension_type SubDim1, dimension_type SubDim2>
 852struct Sliced2_block_map {};
 853
 854template <dimension_type Dim, dimension_type SubDim>
 855struct Sliced_block_map<Global_map<Dim>, SubDim>
 856{
 857  typedef Global_map<Dim - 1> type;
 858  static type convert_map(Global_map<Dim> const&, index_type) { return type();}
 859}; 
 860
 861template <dimension_type Dim, dimension_type SubDim>
 862struct Sliced_block_map<Local_or_global_map<Dim>, SubDim>
 863{
 864  typedef Local_or_global_map<Dim - 1> type;
 865  static type convert_map(Local_or_global_map<Dim> const&, index_type)
 866    { return type();}
 867}; 
 868
 869template <dimension_type SubDim>
 870struct Sliced_block_map<Local_map, SubDim>
 871{
 872  typedef Local_map type;
 873  static type convert_map(Local_map const&, index_type) { return type();}
 874}; 
 875
 876template <dimension_type Dim, dimension_type SubDim>
 877struct Sliced_block_map<Scalar_block_map<Dim>, SubDim>
 878{
 879  typedef Scalar_block_map<Dim - 1> type;
 880  static type convert_map(Scalar_block_map<Dim> const&, index_type)
 881    { return type();}
 882}; 
 883
 884template <typename Dist0,
 885          typename Dist1,
 886          typename Dist2,
 887	  dimension_type D>
 888struct Sliced_block_map<Map<Dist0, Dist1, Dist2>, D>
 889{
 890  typedef typename Map_project_1<D, Map<Dist0, Dist1, Dist2> >::type type;
 891
 892  static type convert_map(Map<Dist0, Dist1, Dist2> const& map, index_type i)
 893  {
 894    return Map_project_1<D, Map<Dist0, Dist1, Dist2> >::project(map, i);
 895  }
 896
 897  static index_type parent_subblock(Map<Dist0, Dist1, Dist2> const& map,
 898				    index_type i,
 899				    index_type sb)
 900  {
 901    return Map_project_1<D, Map<Dist0, Dist1, Dist2> >::parent_subblock(map, i, sb);
 902  }
 903}; 
 904
 905template <dimension_type Dim,
 906	  dimension_type SubDim1,
 907	  dimension_type SubDim2>
 908struct Sliced2_block_map<Global_map<Dim>, SubDim1, SubDim2>
 909{
 910  typedef Global_map<Dim - 2> type;
 911  static type convert_map(Global_map<Dim> const&, index_type, index_type) { return type();}
 912}; 
 913
 914template <dimension_type SubDim1,
 915	  dimension_type SubDim2>
 916struct Sliced2_block_map<Local_map, SubDim1, SubDim2>
 917{
 918  typedef Local_map type;
 919  static type convert_map(Local_map const&, index_type, index_type) { return type();}
 920}; 
 921
 922template <typename       Dist0,
 923          typename       Dist1,
 924          typename       Dist2,
 925	  dimension_type SubDim1,
 926	  dimension_type SubDim2>
 927struct Sliced2_block_map<Map<Dist0, Dist1, Dist2>, SubDim1, SubDim2>
 928{
 929  typedef Map_project_2<SubDim1, SubDim2, Map<Dist0, Dist1, Dist2> > project_t;
 930  typedef typename project_t::type type;
 931
 932  static type convert_map(Map<Dist0, Dist1, Dist2> const& map,
 933			  index_type idx0,
 934			  index_type idx1)
 935    { return project_t::project(map, idx0, idx1); }
 936
 937  static index_type parent_subblock(Map<Dist0, Dist1, Dist2> const& map,
 938				    index_type idx0,
 939				    index_type idx1,
 940				    index_type sb)
 941    { return project_t::parent_subblock(map, idx0, idx1, sb); }
 942}; 
 943
 944/// The Sliced_block class binds one of the indices of the underlying
 945/// N-dimensional block to a constant, producing an N-1-dimensional
 946/// block.  N must be 2 or 3, and the index chosen must be allowed for
 947/// the underlying block.
 948template <typename Block, dimension_type D> class Sliced_block;
 949
 950/// Store Sliced_block by-value.
 951template <typename Block, dimension_type D>
 952struct View_block_storage<Sliced_block<Block, D> >
 953  : By_value_block_storage<Sliced_block<Block, D> >
 954{};
 955
 956/// Sliced_block has impl_ref if the underlying block has impl_ref.
 957template <typename Block, dimension_type D>
 958struct Lvalue_factory_type<Sliced_block<Block, D> >
 959{
 960  typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<Block>
 961    ::template Rebind<Sliced_block<Block, D> >::type type;
 962  template <typename OtherBlock>
 963  struct Rebind {
 964    typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<Block>
 965      ::template Rebind<OtherBlock>::type type;
 966  };
 967};
 968
 969template <typename BlockT, dimension_type D>
 970struct Is_modifiable_block<Sliced_block<BlockT, D> >
 971  : Is_modifiable_block<BlockT>
 972{};
 973
 974template <typename Block, dimension_type D> 
 975class Sliced_block_base : public impl::Compile_time_assert<(Block::dim >= 2)>,
 976			  public impl::Non_assignable
 977{
 978public:
 979  // Compile-time values and types.
 980  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim - 1;
 981  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
 982  typedef value_type&                reference_type;
 983  typedef value_type const&          const_reference_type;
 984  typedef typename Sliced_block_map<typename Block::map_type,
 985                                    D>::type map_type;
 986
 987  // Constructors and destructors.
 988  Sliced_block_base(Sliced_block_base const& sb) VSIP_NOTHROW
 989    : map_(sb.map_), blk_(&*sb.blk_), index_(sb.index_)
 990  { map_.impl_apply(block_domain<dim>(*this)); }
 991  Sliced_block_base(Block &blk, index_type i) VSIP_NOTHROW
 992    : map_(Sliced_block_map<typename Block::map_type,
 993	                    D>::convert_map(blk.map(), i)),
 994      blk_(&blk),
 995      index_(i)
 996  { map_.impl_apply(block_domain<dim>(*this)); }
 997  ~Sliced_block_base() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 998
 999  map_type const& map() const { return map_;}
1000
1001  // Accessors.
1002  // The total size of a sliced block is the total size of the underlying
1003  // block, divided by the size of the bound index.
1004  length_type size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
1005  { return index_ == no_index ? 0 : blk_->size() / blk_->size(Block::dim, D);}
1006  length_type size(dimension_type block_d, dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
1007  { return index_ == no_index ? 0 :
1008      blk_->size(block_d + 1, Compare<dimension_type, D>() > d ? d : d + 1);
1009  }
1010  // These are noops as Sliced_block is helt by-value.
1011  void increment_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
1012  void decrement_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
1013
1014  Block const& impl_block() const { return *this->blk_; }
1015  index_type   impl_index() const { return this->index_; }
1016
1017  // Support Direct_data interface.
1018public:
1019  typedef impl::Storage<typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type, value_type>
1020		storage_type;
1021  typedef typename storage_type::type       data_type;
1022  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_data_type;
1023
1024  par_ll_pbuf_type impl_ll_pbuf() VSIP_NOTHROW
1025  { return blk_->impl_ll_pbuf(); }
1026
1027  stride_type impl_offset() VSIP_NOTHROW
1028  {
1029    return blk_->impl_offset() + index_*blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim, D);
1030  }
1031
1032  data_type       impl_data()       VSIP_NOTHROW
1033  {
1034    return storage_type::offset(blk_->impl_data(),
1035				index_*blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim, D));
1036  }
1037  const_data_type impl_data() const VSIP_NOTHROW
1038  {
1039    return storage_type::offset(blk_->impl_data(),
1040				index_*blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim, D));
1041  }
1042  stride_type impl_stride(dimension_type Dim, dimension_type d)
1043     const VSIP_NOTHROW
1044  {
1045    assert(Dim == dim && d<dim);
1046    return blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim,
1047			     Compare<dimension_type, D>() > d ? d : d+1);
1048  }
1049
1050protected:
1051  // Data members.
1052  map_type                                 map_;
1053  typename View_block_storage<Block>::type blk_;
1054  index_type const                         index_;
1055};
1056
1057template <typename Block>
1058class Sliced_block<Block, 0> : public Sliced_block_base<Block, 0>
1059{
1060  typedef Sliced_block_base<Block, 0> Base;
1061public:
1062  typedef typename Base::value_type value_type;
1063  typedef typename Base::reference_type reference_type;
1064
1065  Sliced_block(Sliced_block const& sb) VSIP_NOTHROW : Base(sb) {}
1066  Sliced_block(Block &blk, index_type i) VSIP_NOTHROW : Base(blk, i) {}
1067
1068  // Data accessors.
1069  value_type get(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
1070  { return this->blk_->get(this->index_, i);}
1071  value_type get(index_type i, index_type j) const VSIP_NOTHROW
1072  { return this->blk_->get(this->index_, i, j);}
1073
1074  void put(index_type i, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
1075  { this->blk_->put(this->index_, i, val);}
1076  void put(index_type i, index_type j, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
1077  { this->blk_->put(this->index_, i, j, val);}
1078
1079  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i) VSIP_NOTHROW
1080  { return this->blk_->impl_ref(this->index_, i); }
1081  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j) VSIP_NOTHROW
1082  { return this->blk_->impl_ref(this->index_, i, j); }
1083};
1084
1085template <typename Block>
1086class Sliced_block<Block, 1> : public Sliced_block_base<Block, 1>
1087{
1088  typedef Sliced_block_base<Block, 1> Base;
1089public:
1090  typedef typename Base::value_type value_type;
1091  typedef typename Base::reference_type reference_type;
1092
1093  Sliced_block(Sliced_block const& sb) VSIP_NOTHROW : Base(sb) {}
1094  Sliced_block(Block &blk, index_type i) VSIP_NOTHROW : Base(blk, i) {}
1095
1096  // Data accessors.
1097  value_type get(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
1098  { return this->blk_->get(i, this->index_);}
1099  value_type get(index_type i, index_type j) const VSIP_NOTHROW
1100  { return this->blk_->get(i, this->index_, j);}
1101
1102  void put(index_type i, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
1103  { this->blk_->put(i, this->index_, val);}
1104  void put(index_type i, index_type j, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
1105  { this->blk_->put(i, this->index_, j, val);}
1106
1107  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
1108  { return this->blk_->impl_ref(i, this->index_);}
1109  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j) const VSIP_NOTHROW
1110  { return this->blk_->impl_ref(i, this->index_, j);}
1111};
1112
1113template <typename Block>
1114class Sliced_block<Block, 2> : public Sliced_block_base<Block, 2>
1115{
1116  typedef Sliced_block_base<Block, 2> Base;
1117public:
1118  typedef typename Base::value_type value_type;
1119  typedef typename Base::reference_type reference_type;
1120
1121  Sliced_block(Sliced_block const& sb) VSIP_NOTHROW : Base(sb) {}
1122  Sliced_block(Block &blk, index_type i) VSIP_NOTHROW : Base(blk, i) {}
1123
1124  // Data accessors.
1125  value_type get(index_type i, index_type j) const VSIP_NOTHROW
1126  { return this->blk_->get(i, j, this->index_);}
1127
1128  void put(index_type i, index_type j, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
1129  { this->blk_->put(i, j, this->index_, val);}
1130
1131  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i, index_type j) const VSIP_NOTHROW
1132  { return this->blk_->impl_ref(i, j, this->index_);}
1133};
1134
1135
1136/// The Sliced2_block class binds two of the indices of the underlying
1137/// N-dimensional block to a constant, producing an N-2-dimensional
1138/// block.  N must be >= 3, and the index chosen must be allowed for
1139/// the underlying block.
1140template <typename Block, dimension_type D1, dimension_type D2> 
1141class Sliced2_block;
1142
1143/// Store Sliced2_block by-value.
1144template <typename Block, dimension_type D1, dimension_type D2>
1145struct View_block_storage<Sliced2_block<Block, D1, D2> >
1146  : By_value_block_storage<Sliced2_block<Block, D1, D2> >
1147{};
1148
1149/// Sliced2_block has impl_ref if the underlying block has impl_ref.
1150template <typename Block, dimension_type D1, dimension_type D2>
1151struct Lvalue_factory_type<Sliced2_block<Block, D1, D2> >
1152{
1153  typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<Block>
1154    ::template Rebind<Sliced2_block<Block, D1, D2> >::type type;
1155  template <typename OtherBlock>
1156  struct Rebind {
1157    typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<Block>
1158      ::template Rebind<OtherBlock>::type type;
1159  };
1160};
1161
1162template <typename BlockT, dimension_type D1, dimension_type D2>
1163struct Is_modifiable_block<Sliced2_block<BlockT, D1, D2> >
1164  : Is_modifiable_block<BlockT>
1165{};
1166
1167template <typename Block, dimension_type D1, dimension_type D2>
1168class Sliced2_block_base 
1169  : public impl::Compile_time_assert<(Block::dim > D2 && D2 > D1)>,
1170    public impl::Non_assignable
1171{
1172public:
1173  // Compile-time values and types.
1174  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim - 2;
1175  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
1176  typedef value_type&       reference_type;
1177  typedef value_type const& const_reference_type;
1178  typedef typename Sliced2_block_map<typename Block::map_type,
1179                                     D1,
1180                                     D2>::type map_type;
1181
1182  // Constructors and destructors.
1183  Sliced2_block_base(Sliced2_block_base const& sb) VSIP_NOTHROW
1184    : map_(sb.map_), blk_(&*sb.blk_), index1_(sb.index1_), index2_(sb.index2_)
1185  { map_.impl_apply(block_domain<dim>(*this)); }
1186  Sliced2_block_base(Block &blk, index_type i, index_type j) VSIP_NOTHROW
1187    : map_(Sliced2_block_map<typename Block::map_type,
1188	                     D1,
1189	                     D2>::convert_map(blk.map(), i, j)),
1190      blk_(&blk), index1_(i), index2_(j)
1191  { map_.impl_apply(block_domain<dim>(*this)); }
1192  ~Sliced2_block_base() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
1193
1194  map_type const& map() const { return map_;}
1195
1196  // Accessors.
1197  // The total size of a sliced block is the total size of the underlying
1198  // block, divided by the size of the bound index.
1199  length_type size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
1200  { return blk_->size() / blk_->size(Block::dim, D1) / blk_->size(Block::dim, D2);}
1201  length_type size(dimension_type block_d, dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
1202  { return blk_->size(block_d + 2,
1203		      Compare<dimension_type, D1>() > d     ? d   :
1204		      Compare<dimension_type, D2>() > (d+1) ? d+1 : d+2);
1205  }
1206  // These are noops as Sliced2_block is helt by-value.
1207  void increment_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
1208  void decrement_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
1209
1210  Block const& impl_block()  const { return *this->blk_; }
1211  index_type   impl_index1() const { return this->index1_; }
1212  index_type   impl_index2() const { return this->index2_; }
1213
1214  // Support Direct_data interface.
1215public:
1216  typedef impl::Storage<typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type, value_type>
1217		storage_type;
1218  typedef typename storage_type::type       data_type;
1219  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_data_type;
1220
1221  par_ll_pbuf_type impl_ll_pbuf() VSIP_NOTHROW
1222  { return blk_->impl_ll_pbuf(); }
1223
1224  stride_type impl_offset() VSIP_NOTHROW
1225  {
1226    return blk_->impl_offset()
1227	 + index1_*blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim, D1)
1228	 + index2_*blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim, D2);
1229  }
1230
1231  data_type       impl_data()       VSIP_NOTHROW
1232  {
1233    return storage_type::offset(blk_->impl_data(),
1234				+ index1_*blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim, D1)
1235				+ index2_*blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim, D2));
1236  }
1237
1238  const_data_type impl_data() const VSIP_NOTHROW
1239  {
1240    return storage_type::offset(blk_->impl_data(),
1241				+ index1_*blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim, D1)
1242				+ index2_*blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim, D2));
1243  }
1244
1245  stride_type impl_stride(dimension_type Dim, dimension_type d)
1246     const VSIP_NOTHROW
1247  {
1248    assert(Dim == dim && d<dim);
1249    return blk_->impl_stride(Block::dim,
1250		      Compare<dimension_type, D1>() > d     ? d   :
1251		      Compare<dimension_type, D2>() > (d+1) ? d+1 : d+2);
1252  }
1253
1254protected:
1255  // Data members.
1256  map_type                                 map_;
1257  typename View_block_storage<Block>::type blk_;
1258  index_type const                         index1_;
1259  index_type const                         index2_;
1260};
1261
1262template <typename Block>
1263class Sliced2_block<Block, 0, 1> : public Sliced2_block_base<Block, 0, 1>
1264{
1265  typedef Sliced2_block_base<Block, 0, 1> Base;
1266public:
1267  typedef typename Base::value_type value_type;
1268  typedef typename Base::reference_type reference_type;
1269
1270  Sliced2_block(Sliced2_block const& sb) VSIP_NOTHROW : Base(sb) {}
1271  Sliced2_block(Block &blk, index_type i, index_type j) VSIP_NOTHROW 
1272    : Base(blk, i, j)
1273  {}
1274
1275  // Data accessors.
1276  value_type get(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
1277  { return this->blk_->get(this->index1_, this->index2_, i);}
1278
1279  void put(index_type i, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
1280  { this->blk_->put(this->index1_, this->index2_, i, val);}
1281
1282  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
1283  { return this->blk_->impl_ref(this->index1_, this->index2_, i);}
1284};
1285
1286template <typename Block>
1287class Sliced2_block<Block, 0, 2> : public Sliced2_block_base<Block, 0, 2>
1288{
1289  typedef Sliced2_block_base<Block, 0, 2> Base;
1290public:
1291  typedef typename Base::value_type value_type;
1292  typedef typename Base::reference_type reference_type;
1293
1294  Sliced2_block(Sliced2_block const& sb) VSIP_NOTHROW : Base(sb) {}
1295  Sliced2_block(Block &blk, index_type i, index_type j) VSIP_NOTHROW 
1296    : Base(blk, i, j)
1297  {}
1298
1299  // Data accessors.
1300  value_type get(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
1301  { return this->blk_->get(this->index1_, i, this->index2_);}
1302
1303  void put(index_type i, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
1304  { this->blk_->put(this->index1_, i, this->index2_, val);}
1305
1306  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
1307  { return this->blk_->impl_ref(this->index1_, i, this->index2_);}
1308};
1309
1310template <typename Block>
1311class Sliced2_block<Block, 1, 2> : public Sliced2_block_base<Block, 1, 2>
1312{
1313  typedef Sliced2_block_base<Block, 1, 2> Base;
1314public:
1315  typedef typename Base::value_type value_type;
1316  typedef typename Base::reference_type reference_type;
1317
1318  Sliced2_block(Sliced2_block const& sb) VSIP_NOTHROW : Base(sb) {}
1319  Sliced2_block(Block &blk, index_type i, index_type j) VSIP_NOTHROW 
1320    : Base(blk, i, j)
1321  {}
1322
1323  // Data accessors.
1324  value_type get(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
1325  { return this->blk_->get(i, this->index1_, this->index2_);}
1326
1327  void put(index_type i, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
1328  { this->blk_->put(i, this->index1_, this->index2_, val);}
1329
1330  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
1331  { return this->blk_->impl_ref(i, this->index1_, this->index2_);}
1332};
1333
1334
1335
1336template <typename       Tuple,
1337	  dimension_type NumDim,
1338	  dimension_type FixedDim>
1339struct Sliced_block_order;
1340
1341template <dimension_type Dim0,
1342	  dimension_type Dim1,
1343	  dimension_type Dim2,
1344	  dimension_type FixedDim>
1345struct Sliced_block_order<tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2>, 2, FixedDim>
1346{
1347  typedef row1_type type;
1348  static bool const unit_stride_preserved = (FixedDim != Dim1);
1349};
1350
1351template <dimension_type Dim0,
1352	  dimension_type Dim1,
1353	  dimension_type Dim2,
1354	  dimension_type FixedDim>
1355struct Sliced_block_order<tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2>, 3, FixedDim>
1356{
1357  typedef typename
1358  ITE_Type<FixedDim == Dim0,
1359	   ITE_Type<(Dim2 > Dim1), As_type<row2_type>, As_type<col2_type> >,
1360  ITE_Type<FixedDim == Dim1,
1361	   ITE_Type<(Dim2 > Dim0), As_type<row2_type>, As_type<col2_type> >,
1362           ITE_Type<(Dim1 > Dim0), As_type<row2_type>, As_type<col2_type> >
1363          > >::type
1364		type;
1365  static bool const unit_stride_preserved = (FixedDim != Dim2);
1366};
1367
1368
1369
1370template <typename       BlockT,
1371	  dimension_type Dim>
1372struct Block_root<Sliced_block<BlockT, Dim> >
1373{
1374  typedef typename Block_root<BlockT>::type type;
1375};
1376
1377template <typename       BlockT,
1378	  dimension_type Dim>
1379typename Block_root<Sliced_block<BlockT, Dim> >::type const&
1380block_root(Sliced_block<BlockT, Dim> const& block)
1381{
1382  return block_root(block.impl_block());
1383}
1384
1385
1386
1387template <typename       Block,
1388	  dimension_type Dim>
1389struct Block_layout<Sliced_block<Block, Dim> >
1390{
1391  // Dimension: reduced by 1
1392  // Access   : Same
1393  // Order    : preserve non-fixed order
1394  // Stride   : Stride_unit if parent Stride_unit* and FixeDim != 0,
1395  //            Stride_unknown otherwise
1396  // Cmplx    : Same
1397private:
1398  typedef Sliced_block_order<typename Block_layout<Block>::order_type,
1399			   Block::dim,
1400			   Dim> sbo_type;
1401
1402public:
1403
1404  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim-1;
1405
1406  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::access_type access_type;
1407  typedef typename sbo_type::type                   order_type;
1408  typedef typename ITE_Type<
1409    Block_layout<Block>::pack_type::is_ct_unit_stride &&
1410    sbo_type::unit_stride_preserved,
1411    As_type<Stride_unit>, As_type<Stride_unknown> >::type pack_type;
1412  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type complex_type;
1413
1414  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> layout_type;
1415};
1416
1417
1418
1419template <typename       BlockT,
1420	  dimension_type D1,
1421	  dimension_type D2> 
1422struct Block_root<Sliced2_block<BlockT, D1, D2> >
1423{
1424  typedef typename Block_root<BlockT>::type type;
1425};
1426
1427template <typename       BlockT,
1428	  dimension_type D1,
1429	  dimension_type D2> 
1430typename Block_root<Sliced2_block<BlockT, D1, D2> >::type const&
1431block_root(Sliced2_block<BlockT, D1, D2> const& block)
1432{
1433  return block_root(block.impl_block());
1434}
1435
1436
1437
1438template <typename       Block,
1439	  dimension_type D1,
1440	  dimension_type D2> 
1441struct Block_layout<Sliced2_block<Block, D1, D2> >
1442{
1443  // Dimension: reduced by 2
1444  // Access   : Same
1445  // Order    : preserve non-fixed order
1446  // Stride   : Stride_unit if parent Stride_unit* and 
1447  //                           D1 != lowest dim and D2 != lowest dim
1448  //            Stride_unknown otherwise
1449  // Cmplx    : Same
1450private:
1451  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::order_type par_order_type;
1452
1453public:
1454  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim-2;
1455
1456  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::access_type access_type;
1457  typedef row1_type                                 order_type;
1458
1459  typedef typename ITE_Type<
1460    Block_layout<Block>::pack_type::is_ct_unit_stride &&
1461    D1 != par_order_type::impl_dim2 && D2 != par_order_type::impl_dim2,
1462    As_type<Stride_unit>, As_type<Stride_unknown> >::type pack_type;
1463  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type complex_type;
1464
1465  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> layout_type;
1466};

1523
1524/// Helper class to translate a distributed subset into a local subset.
1525///
1526/// In general case, ask the parent block what the local subset should be.
1527template <typename BlockT,
1528	  typename MapT = typename BlockT::map_type>
1529struct Subset_parent_local_domain
1530{
1531  static dimension_type const dim = BlockT::dim;
1532
1533  static Domain<dim> parent_local_domain(BlockT const& block, index_type sb)
1534  {
1535    return block.impl_block().map().impl_local_from_global_domain(sb,
1536					block.impl_domain());
1537  }
1538};
1539
1540
1541
1542/// Specialize for Subset_map, where the local subset is currently larger than
1543/// what the parent thinks it should be.
1544template <typename       BlockT,
1545	  dimension_type Dim>
1546struct Subset_parent_local_domain<BlockT, Subset_map<Dim> >
1547{
1548  static dimension_type const dim = BlockT::dim;
1549
1550  static Domain<dim> parent_local_domain(BlockT const& block, index_type sb)
1551  {
1552#if 0
1553    // consider asking Subset_map about parent's local block,
1554    // rather than asking the parent to recompute it.
1555    return block.map().template impl_parent_local_domain<dim>(sb);
1556#else
1557    index_type parent_sb = block.map().impl_parent_subblock(sb);
1558    return block.impl_block().map().impl_local_from_global_domain(parent_sb,
1559					block.impl_domain());
1560#endif
1561  }
1562};
1563
1564
1565
1566template <typename Block>
1567Subset_block<typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::type>
1568get_local_block(
1569  Subset_block<Block> const& block)
1570{
1571  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::type super_type;
1572  typedef Subset_block<super_type>                      local_block_type;
1573
1574  dimension_type const dim = Subset_block<Block>::dim;
1575
1576  index_type sb = block.map().impl_rank_from_proc(local_processor());
1577  Domain<dim> dom;
1578
1579  if (sb != no_subblock)
1580    dom = Subset_parent_local_domain<Subset_block<Block> >::
1581      parent_local_domain(block, sb);
1582  else
1583    dom = empty_domain<dim>();
1584
1585  typename View_block_storage<super_type>::plain_type
1586    super_block = get_local_block(block.impl_block());
1587
1588  return local_block_type(dom, super_block);
1589}
1590
1591
1592
1593template <typename Block>
1594Subset_block<typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::proxy_type>
1595get_local_proxy(
1596  Subset_block<Block> const& block,
1597  index_type                    sb)
1598{
1599  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim;
1600
1601  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::proxy_type super_type;
1602  typedef Subset_block<super_type>                            local_proxy_type;
1603
1604  index_type super_sb = Subset_block_map<dim, typename Block::map_type>::
1605    parent_subblock(block.impl_block().map(), block.impl_domain(), sb);
1606
1607  Domain<dim> l_dom = block.impl_block().map().
1608    impl_local_from_global_domain(sb,
1609				  block.impl_domain());
1610
1611  typename View_block_storage<super_type>::plain_type
1612    super_block = get_local_proxy(block.impl_block(), super_sb);
1613
1614  return local_proxy_type(l_dom, super_block);
1615}
1616
1617
1618
1619template <typename       Block,
1620	  dimension_type D>
1621Sliced_block<typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::type, D>
1622get_local_block(
1623  Sliced_block<Block, D> const& block)
1624{
1625  typedef Sliced_block<typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::type, D>
1626	local_block_type;
1627
1628  // This conversion is only valid if the local processor holds
1629  // the subblock containing the slice.
1630
1631  index_type idx;
1632  if (block.map().subblock() != no_subblock)
1633    idx = block.impl_block().map().
1634      impl_local_from_global_index(D, block.impl_index());
1635  else
1636    idx = no_index;
1637
1638  return local_block_type(get_local_block(block.impl_block()), idx);
1639}
1640
1641
1642
1643template <typename       Block,
1644	  dimension_type D>
1645Sliced_block<typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::proxy_type, D>
1646get_local_proxy(
1647  Sliced_block<Block, D> const& block,
1648  index_type                    sb)
1649{
1650  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::proxy_type super_type;
1651  typedef Sliced_block<super_type, D>                         local_proxy_type;
1652
1653  index_type super_sb = Sliced_block_map<typename Block::map_type, D>::
1654    parent_subblock(block.impl_block().map(), block.impl_index(), sb);
1655
1656  index_type l_idx = block.impl_block().map().
1657      impl_local_from_global_index(D, block.impl_index());
1658
1659  typename View_block_storage<super_type>::plain_type
1660    super_block = get_local_proxy(block.impl_block(), super_sb);
1661  return local_proxy_type(super_block, l_idx);
1662}
1663
1664
1665
1666template <typename       Block,
1667	  dimension_type D1,
1668	  dimension_type D2>
1669Sliced2_block<typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::type, D1, D2>
1670get_local_block(
1671  Sliced2_block<Block, D1, D2> const& block)
1672{
1673  typedef Sliced2_block<typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::type, D1, D2>
1674	local_block_type;
1675
1676  index_type idx1 = block.impl_block().map().
1677    impl_local_from_global_index(D1, block.impl_index1());
1678  index_type idx2 = block.impl_block().map().
1679    impl_local_from_global_index(D2, block.impl_index2());
1680
1681  return local_block_type(get_local_block(block.impl_block()), idx1, idx2);
1682}
1683
1684
1685
1686template <typename       Block,
1687	  dimension_type D1,
1688	  dimension_type D2>
1689Sliced2_block<typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::proxy_type, D1, D2>
1690get_local_proxy(
1691  Sliced2_block<Block, D1, D2> const& block,
1692  index_type                          sb)
1693{
1694  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::proxy_type super_type;
1695  typedef Sliced2_block<super_type, D1, D2>                   local_block_type;
1696
1697  index_type l_idx1 = block.impl_block().map().
1698    impl_local_from_global_index(D1, block.impl_index1());
1699  index_type l_idx2 = block.impl_block().map().
1700    impl_local_from_global_index(D2, block.impl_index2());
1701
1702  index_type super_sb = Sliced2_block_map<typename Block::map_type, D1, D2>::
1703    parent_subblock(block.impl_block().map(),
1704		    block.impl_index1(), block.impl_index2(), sb);
1705
1706  typename View_block_storage<super_type>::plain_type
1707    super_block = get_local_proxy(block.impl_block(), super_sb);
1708
1709  return local_block_type(get_local_block(block.impl_block()), l_idx1, l_idx2);
1710}
1711

1720  typedef Transposed_block<super_type>                  local_block_type;

1724

1829#if VSIP_IMPL_USE_GENERIC_VISITOR_TEMPLATES==0
1830
1831/// Specialize Combine_return_type for Subset_block leaves.
1832template <typename       CombineT,
1833	  typename       Block>
1834struct Combine_return_type<CombineT, Subset_block<Block> >
1835{
1836  typedef Subset_block<Block> block_type;
1837  typedef typename CombineT::template return_type<block_type>::type
1838		type;
1839  typedef typename CombineT::template tree_type<block_type>::type
1840		tree_type;
1841};
1842
1843
1844
1845/// Specialize apply_combine for Subset_block leaves.
1846template <typename       CombineT,
1847	  typename       Block>
1848typename Combine_return_type<CombineT, Subset_block<Block> >::type
1849apply_combine(
1850  CombineT const&               combine,
1851  Subset_block<Block> const& block)
1852{
1853  return combine.apply(block);
1854}
1855

1861	  dimension_type D>
1862struct Combine_return_type<CombineT, Sliced_block<Block, D> >
1863{

1865  typedef typename CombineT::template return_type<block_type>::type

1868		tree_type;

1946
1947/// The Diag_block class is similar to the Sliced_block class, 
1948/// producing diagonal slices based on an offset.  The center diagonal
1949/// is obtained with offset zero.   Positive values refer to diagonals
1950/// above the center and negative values to diagonals below.
1951/// Note the length of the resultant vector is affected by the size of
1952/// the original matrix as well as the offset from the main diagonal.
1953template <typename Block> 
1954class Diag_block;
1955
1956
1957/// Store Diag_block by-value.
1958template <typename Block>
1959struct View_block_storage<Diag_block<Block> >
1960  : By_value_block_storage<Diag_block<Block> >
1961{};
1962
1963template <typename Block>
1964struct Block_layout<Diag_block<Block> >
1965{
1966  // Dimension: Same
1967  // Access   : Same
1968  // Order    : Same
1969  // Stride   : Stride_unknown
1970  // Cmplx    : Same
1971
1972  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
1973
1974  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::access_type  access_type;
1975  typedef row1_type                                  order_type;
1976  typedef Stride_unknown                             pack_type;
1977  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type complex_type;
1978
1979  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> layout_type;
1980};
1981
1982
1983/// Diag_block has impl_ref if the underlying block has impl_ref.
1984template <typename BlockT>
1985struct Lvalue_factory_type<Diag_block<BlockT> >
1986{
1987  typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<BlockT>
1988    ::template Rebind<Diag_block<BlockT> >::type type;
1989  template <typename OtherBlock>
1990  struct Rebind {
1991    typedef typename Lvalue_factory_type<BlockT>
1992      ::template Rebind<OtherBlock>::type type;
1993  };
1994};
1995
1996template <typename BlockT>
1997struct Is_modifiable_block<Diag_block<BlockT> >
1998  : Is_modifiable_block<BlockT>
1999{};
2000
2001template <typename Block> 
2002class Diag_block 
2003    : public impl::Compile_time_assert<(Block::dim == 2)>,
2004      public impl::Non_assignable
2005{
2006 public:
2007  // Compile-time values and types.
2008  static dimension_type const dim = Block::dim - 1;
2009  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
2010  typedef value_type&       reference_type;
2011  typedef value_type const& const_reference_type;
2012  typedef typename Block::map_type map_type;
2013
2014
2015  // Constructors and destructors.
2016  Diag_block(Diag_block const& sb) VSIP_NOTHROW
2017    : blk_(&*sb.blk_), offset_(sb.offset_)
2018    { }
2019  Diag_block(Block &blk, index_difference_type offset) VSIP_NOTHROW
2020    : blk_(&blk), offset_(offset)
2021    { }
2022  ~Diag_block() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
2023
2024
2025  // Accessors.
2026  // The total size of a diagonal is...
2027  length_type size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
2028    { 
2029      assert(dim == 1);
2030      length_type size = 0;
2031      length_type limit = std::min(this->blk_->size(2, 0), this->blk_->size(2, 1));
2032      if ( this->offset_ >= 0 )
2033        size = std::min( limit, this->blk_->size(2, 1) - this->offset_ );
2034      else
2035        size = std::min( limit, this->blk_->size(2, 0) + this->offset_ );
2036
2037      return size;
2038    }
2039  length_type size(dimension_type block_d, dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
2040    { 
2041      assert(block_d == 1 && dim == 1 && d == 0);
2042      return this->size();
2043    }
2044
2045  // These are noops as Diag_block is held by-value.
2046  void increment_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
2047  void decrement_count() const VSIP_NOTHROW {}
2048  map_type const& map() const { return this->blk_->map(); }
2049
2050  // Data accessors.
2051  value_type get(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW
2052    { 
2053      if ( this->offset_ >= 0 )
2054        return this->blk_->get(i, i + this->offset_);
2055      else 
2056        return this->blk_->get(i - this->offset_, i);
2057    }
2058
2059  void put(index_type i, value_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
2060    {
2061      if ( this->offset_ >= 0 )
2062        return this->blk_->put(i, i + this->offset_, val);
2063      else 
2064        return this->blk_->put(i - this->offset_, i, val);
2065    }
2066  
2067  reference_type impl_ref(index_type i) VSIP_NOTHROW
2068    {
2069      if ( this->offset_ >= 0 )
2070        return this->blk_->impl_ref(i, i + this->offset_);
2071      else
2072        return this->blk_->impl_ref(i - this->offset_, i);
2073    }
2074  
2075  // Support Direct_data interface.
2076 public:
2077  typedef impl::Storage<typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type, value_type>
2078    storage_type;
2079  typedef typename storage_type::type       data_type;
2080  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_data_type;
2081
2082  data_type       impl_data()       VSIP_NOTHROW
2083    { 
2084      if ( this->offset_ >= 0 )
2085        return storage_type::offset(
2086		this->blk_->impl_data(),
2087		+ this->offset_ * this->blk_->impl_stride(2, 1));
2088      else
2089        return storage_type::offset(
2090		this->blk_->impl_data(),
2091		- this->offset_ * this->blk_->impl_stride(2, 0));
2092    }
2093
2094  const_data_type impl_data() const VSIP_NOTHROW
2095    { 
2096      if ( this->offset_ >= 0 )
2097        return this->blk_->impl_data() + this->offset_ * this->blk_->impl_stride(2, 1);
2098      else
2099        return this->blk_->impl_data() - this->offset_ * this->blk_->impl_stride(2, 0);
2100    }
2101
2102  stride_type impl_stride(dimension_type Dim, dimension_type d)
2103    const VSIP_NOTHROW
2104    {
2105      assert(Dim == dim && d<dim);
2106      return this->blk_->impl_stride(2, 0) + this->blk_->impl_stride(2, 1);
2107    }
2108  
2109 private:
2110  // Data members.
2111  typename View_block_storage<Block>::type blk_;
2112  index_difference_type const              offset_;
2113};
2114
2115
2116
2117
2118} // namespace vsip::impl
2119} // namespace vsip
